Claim: "A man in a suit cheered in a library in front of children."
Implication: "A guy is cheering near some children."
Referring expressions: A man in a suit, children, library
Formula: (exists a (exists b (IsInLibrary(b) and IsCheeredInFrontOf(a,b))) & (forall f (forall e ( IsInLibrary(e) ->   IsNearChildren(f)))) & (forall i (forall h (forall g (  IsCheeredInFrontOf(g,h) ->  IsCheering(i))))) & (forall l (forall j (forall k (  IsCheeredInFrontOf(j,k) ->   IsNearChildren(l)))))) -> (exists d (IsCheering(d) and IsNearChildren(d)))
